channel.title: Electric guitars
channel.description: I’m trying to make some electric guitars like this (3:04): https://youtu.be/a5uQMwRMHcs I think this would fit good in some dnb/jungle songs, if anyone has some suggestions or ideas on how to make something like that, let me know!

item.title: Electric guitars
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Now being able to adjust sounds in app, its very easy to make a sound like this. But you will have to layer sounds. Angst with heavy distortion makes great power chords, like this. However to make a sound like that lick, try using telecoms, in the Disturbing leads pack, or really, any of the guitars in Auxy’s guitar pack, just with heavy distortion. And as @Dadmother said above, mental is absolutely amazing too! Just mess around with sounds, you can definitely get where you need to.

Read full topic

item.title: Electric guitars
item.dc:creator: Dadmother
item.description:
This is the right idea, for sure. If I’m going for chords in an electric sound, I always layer Subway with a heavy bass, which varies depending on what kind of sound I’m going for. For soloing (or for sounds similar to the video), I usually do Bitty, lowpassed to about 60%, and have about 20% vibratto (changes the attack a bit). I also sometimes layer it with Mental for a more 80s/90s style. I can send some examples your way, @Twizard!

Read full topic

item.title: Electric guitars
item.dc:creator: theodoric_ac
item.description:
I always use something like Arch for a bass with the low pass about half way, and then a subway with the tone at 0 with some distortion (not too much, but not too little) and about 10% or less of the high pass knob up.

Read full topic

item.title: Electric guitars
item.dc:creator: Maland2016
item.description:
Maybe Fuze layered over one of the Electric Basses? I suggest playing around with the automations to get what you’re looking for.
